International human rights law recognizes the “interdependence between human rights and the integrity of the environment.”
8 In other words, “to enjoy human rights fully, it is necessary to have a safe and healthy environment; and to have a safe and healthy environment, it is critical to protect human rights.”
9 We posit that the regulation of fracking requires a robust framework that addresses environmental and public health impacts, as well as the related potential impacts on human rights. To date, this appears not to have been the case in England.
